p: The average PS of F48 and F44 nanoformulations was determined as 172.8 nm and 90.95 nm, and their PDI values were also found to be 0.123 and 0.183, respectively. The ZPs of the two particles were -1.08 mV and -2.08 mV, respectively ( Fig 3A, 3B, 3D and 3E). TEM results revealed that the size of the sphere-shaped droplets was about 100 nm ( Fig 3C and 3F), accordant with the DLS measures. After 40 days, the opacity of the F48 and F44 nanoemulsions did not change in the storage conditions; however, the ZPs were correspondingly raised to -1.79 and 2.52 ( Fig 4). These data indicate that the stability of the prepared nanoemulsions have been maintained during this time.
